Wishing a happy birthday to my good friend and fellow Marylander, @Call_Me_Dutch. Thank you for your leadership on national security and work on @AppropsDems to fund priorities important to Marylanders & working families across the country.

I am cosponsoring @RepRoKhanna’s War Powers resolution today because the American people & Congress deserve the opportunity to weigh in on U.S.’ involvement in #Yemen. I am committed to bringing this resolution to the Floor after committee consideration. http://bit.ly/2SiobwW

The #TrumpShutdown cost our economy at least $11 billion. 

Today, every Member had the opportunity to vote for a resolution stating shutdowns are detrimental and should not occur. Notwithstanding the significant cost of the last shutdown, 163 House Republicans voted against it. pic.twitter.com/JXBE91jjeS
By refusing to say that they will take shutdowns off the table as an option in their negotiating toolbox, @HouseGOP are sending a dangerous threat to the American people.  How shameful.
Today’s vote requires us to ask why these 163 Republicans believe it was appropriate to have lost $11 billion in GDP, which is what the 35 day #TrumpShutdown cost our economy, according to @USCBO.

Today’s vote begs the question as to whether Republicans support requiring federal employees to work without paychecks or putting aviation safety at risk for travelers or preventing food safety screeners from protecting consumers.

Today, 163 @HouseGOP Members voted against a resolution that says shutting down the government is stupid & bad policy.  It is now clear the GOP has every intention of using shutdowns or the threat of shutdowns as a tactic to help @POTUS get his way. http://bit.ly/2HImc0H

Shutdowns are stupid. Today, all Members of Congress will have the opportunity to vote for a resolution stating that shutdowns are detrimental to our country and should not happen. That is all it says. I encourage all of my colleagues to vote yes. RT if you agree. pic.twitter.com/gFiIxbtBG0

I thank my colleagues on @HouseJudiciary for holding the first hearing on #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act. I look forward to bringing this bill to the Floor to restore the American people’s faith in government once we complete committee consideration. https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1090272944574451722 …

For 35 days, @POTUS & the GOP kept the govt shut down, leaving 800k federal employees furloughed or working w/o pay, damaging our nation’s economy, & undermining national security. Here’s why POTUS shouldn’t be threatening to shut down the govt once again: http://bit.ly/2WsOsHZ

Today also marks #Ledbetter10. I was pleased to bring the Lilly Ledbetter #FairPay Act to the Floor ten years ago. I told reporters today that I will join my colleagues to reintroduce the #PaycheckFairness Act tomorrow to build on this legislation’s progress.

I also told reporters I will bring a bill to the Floor tomorrow to provide a 2.6% cost-of-living adjustment for civil servants. We ought to ensure pay parity between uniformed & civilian personnel. I hope @SenateMajLdr will take up the bill once the House passes it.

I opened my weekly press conference this morning by discussing the @USCBO report that said the #TrumpShutdown cost the U.S. economy at least $11 billion. I’m bringing a resolution to the Floor tomorrow to make clear that shutdowns should not be an option.
Happy birthday to the Chairman of @HomelandDems, @BennieGThompson.

I join in remembering the courage & sacrifice of the crew members of Space Shuttle #Challenger, who perished 33 yrs ago today. I spoke on the Floor that day our nation lost 7 great Americans, including my friend Christa McAuliffe. I keep their families in my thoughts & prayers. https://twitter.com/CraigCaplan/status/1089921858596675596 …
Wishing a happy birthday to my friend and a powerful voice for small business owners and working families on @WaysMeansCmte, @RepLindaSanchez.

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend and new Member, @repdelgado. I look forward to working with you on behalf of families in the Hudson Valley and across the country, including increasing access to affordable, quality health care.

Today’s @USCBO Budget and Economic Outlook report shows @POTUS will go down in history as the worst president in terms of fiscal irresponsibility. There is no question that unified GOP control of govt over the last 2 yrs was an unmitigated fiscal disaster. http://bit.ly/2UiUB7C

This shutdown harmed federal employees, small biz, & millions of Americans who couldn’t access government services. I strongly urge @POTUS & the GOP to work with Democrats in good faith over the next three weeks to responsibly fund government and prevent another costly shutdown.

Today’s @USCBO estimate confirms shutting down government is a failed policy that harms our country & people. The fact that the #TrumpShutdown directly cost at least $11B in GDP should give @POTUS & GOP pause before they consider shutting down govt again. http://bit.ly/2UiQBUE

This work begins and ends with every individual citizen, to whom our democracy ultimately assigns the responsibility of rejecting anti-Semitism, xenophobia, and racism in any form. #HolocaustRemembranceDay

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we remember millions of lives taken & communities destroyed. Let us not forget how hatred was spread & doubt was sown in democratic institutions. We must learn from history & confront new challenges w the wisdom of hindsight. http://bit.ly/2DDr0Aw

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend, @RepSires. Thank you for your leadership and commitment to improving human rights around the world and building international partnerships on @HouseForeign Affairs Committee.

Tonight the House passed a bill to end the #TrumpShutdown and pay federal employees. I hope the experience of last 35 days has taught Republicans that we should never repeat this exercise of shutting down government again.

The #TrumpShutdown is the latest in a long list of attacks on our federal civilian workforce. This legislation is an important step in treating our federal employees with the respect they deserve & compensating them for the financial stress the shutdown has inflicted on them.

Joined @GerryConnolly to introduce the Federal Civilian Workforce Pay Raise Fairness Act of 2019 today, which the House will consider next week to the 2019 pay increase for civilian federal employees in line with the raise given to members of the military. https://bit.ly/2ROisiJ
It is deeply upsetting that the Trump shutdown inflicted real harm on many families in #MD05.

Today I stopped by the Southern Maryland Food Bank to drop off canned goods collected by members of my staff. The food bank has seen a significant increase in the number of families needing their services in the past few weeks, including many furloughed federal employees. pic.twitter.com/wXZvI6n1OW

The Democratic-led House voted 11 times to end the #TrumpShutdown, & it will do its part again.  Dems have always supported robust border security, & we will work to ensure that we pursue border security investments that are smart & strategic & in line with our nation’s values.

While I’m relieved @POTUS is finally willing to allow 800,000 federal employees get back to work & receive the paychecks they are due – & restore critical services – it is deeply angering that he inflicted uncertainty & insecurity across the country for no reason for 35 days.

It is deeply concerning the extent to which our elections appear to have been influenced by foreign actors who were in communication with close associates of the President.  The American people deserve to know the full extent of what transpired.

The #TrumpShutdown is not a game and has real-world consequences. If this shutdown does not end immediately, the harmful impact will continue to grow. @POTUS & @senatemajldr must reopen government and pay federal employees now. http://bit.ly/2MxPY7l

After refusing to hold votes to reopen government for more than a month, Senate Republicans voted to continue the Trump-McConnell shutdown today, irresponsibly ignoring the suffering of millions of Americans who are being impacted. http://bit.ly/2FM4h7s

Tony Reardon, @NTEUnews President, also spoke at the #FundTheFrontline & highlighted how many fed employees are currently working overtime & double shifts during the #TrumpShutdown, yet they aren’t being paid. We must #EndTheShutdown now.

Another panelist featured at #FundTheFrontline is @AFGENational President @JDavidCoxSr, who shared startling statistics about turnover as federal employees miss a second paycheck since the #TrumpShutdown began 34 days ago.

Durkovich also highlighted the impact of the #TrumpShutdown on both federal employees and government contractors. There are already reports that top talent is being recruited away from @DHSgov due to the shutdown and lack of continuity. We must #EndTheShutdown.

Caitlin Durkovich, former Asst. Sec. for Infrastructure Protection at @DHSgov, spoke about the importance of data collection & info sharing that is on hold due to the #TrumpShutdown. Failing to #FundTheFrontline impacts our nation’s ability to strengthen election security.

At today’s #FundTheFrontline event, emergency preparedness professional & former Deputy Administrator for Protection & National Preparedness at @FEMA highlighted how much disaster recovery work is on hold right now due to the #TrumpShutdown.

The first panelist, Vice Admiral Peter Neffenger, a former Administrator of @TSA and former @USCG Vice Commandant, discussed the impact of the #TrumpShutdown on recruiting new service members in the Coast Guard. It is time to #EndTheShutdown & #FundTheFrontline.
